column4: my pc powered off in the middle of dist update, and now my ubuntu wont load :(
can you get a terminal
can you get a terminal?
anywhere, if you can boot, thats preferable, but you can use the livecd also
then can you get a terminal at boot?
well, its not too hard to recover, just run: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
did you get any of my messages?  pidgin was acting way weird
yeah, can you get a terminal?
anywhere in ubuntu
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade            and if it says it cant continue because you need to run another command, run that command
did the commands I gave you fail?
well, you can use a livecd too
well, you boot up with the livecd, and then mount your drive, then chroot, and proceed

Im sure you may not follow that, but the first step would be to get a livecd.    Buuuuut, you may want to go a different direction: create a separate /home partition, rsync your settings, then do a clean install of whatever ubuntu you are going for
conflicts?
I dunno, either way, if you don't have a bootable system, then you kinda have to get a bootable cd.  Its up to you
then maybe order a cd through shipit.  That will take like 2 months...
I can't help with that.  If you can't burn a cd, and you cant get a cd, and you cant boot, then you are stuck.  right?
oh, brilliant!  boot that baby!
does the livecd support your internet?
do you know how to mount and chroot?
do you know the partition location of your linux install?
mk, but do you know about partitions?  and can you figure out which one is your linux partition?     anyway, you would mount that partition to a location, then chroot to that
